Thomas Lowell 1892-1981
Lowell Thomas Papers MA-1
Items in this collection do not circulate and may be used in-house only.
Individuals requesting reproductions expressly assume the responsibility for compliance with all pertinent provisions of the Copyright Act, 17 U.S.C. ss101 et seq. Patrons further agree to indemnify and hold harmless the Marist College Archives & http://www.loc.gov/copyright/title17/.
The Lowell Thomas Papers encompasses a wide range of materials documenting the life, family, and professional career of Lowell Thomas.
Lowell Jackson Thomas was born in Woodington, Ohio on 6 April 1892 to two school teachers, Harry G. Thomas and Harriet Wagner Thomas.
Thomas Lowell 1892-1981
Journalism United States
MA-1-01 Textual materials
Correspondence, writings, and other material MA-1-01-01
These files contain correspondence between Thomas family members; published and manuscript writings by Lowell Thomas, including autobiographical content, articles, speeches, and travelogues; and topically-arranged collections of journal articles, newspaper clippings, and ephemera.
American Expeditionary Forces (A.E.F.) MA-1-01-02
General Edmund Allenby MA-1-01-03
MA-1-02 Graphic materials
Comprises photographs, lantern slides, and glass plate negatives accumulated by Frank R. Roberson and Lowell Thomas arranged by topic and geographic coverage.
Dalai Lama XIV 1935-
